item.title: Study Journal ‚Äì Week 4 (June 16‚Äì22)
item.description:
üìù Week 4: Exams and Final Assessments

The most intense week of the month. We had the mathematical logic exam. The questions were challenging: propositional logic semantics, formal proofs, and formula minimization methods. I managed it, but had to do a lot of revision beforehand.

In calculus, one more test remained ‚Äî on integrals. I‚Äôve been learning to choose substitutions and apply integration by parts. Categorizing problems by type really helps.

In programming, we began preparing for the final project. The task is to develop a command-line utility in Python that works with text files. I‚Äôm currently planning the architecture.

item.title: Study Journal ‚Äì Week 3 (June 9‚Äì15)
item.description:
üß† Week 3: Tests and Knowledge Check

The first wave of midterms arrived. We had a progress test in calculus ‚Äî covering derivatives, graphing, and applications. I made a mistake in the tangent line problem, but overall the result was decent.

In programming, we had a test on recursion and strings. I wrote the code quickly, but one task didn‚Äôt work properly due to an incorrect exit condition ‚Äî something to improve next time.

In logic, we were tested on formal derivations and formula transformations. It was tough but engaging. I realized how rigorous logical reasoning forms the foundation for algorithms.
